humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report indicates that the largest tumor size is 2.4 cm, as stated in section C: 'Infiltrating poorly differentiated ductal carcinoma, high nuclear grade, 2.4 cm in greatest dimension.' According to the rules provided, T2 tumors are more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm. Therefore, the pathologic T stage of the patient's cancer is T2.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The T stage for cancer is determined by the size of the tumor. In this report, the size of the invasive component of the tumor is stated as having the greatest dimension of 2.4 cm. According to the TNM staging system, a T2 designation is given to tumors that are greater than 2 cm in size but not greater than 5 cm in size. Therefore, the T stage for this patient's cancer is T2.
